TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CookieAuthenticationOptions extends Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.AuthenticationSchemeOptions

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Create an instance of the options initialized with the default values

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AccessDeniedPath : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString with get, set
public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString AccessDeniedPath { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString value); };

Docs.summary: The AccessDeniedPath property is used by the handler for the redirection target when handling ForbidAsync.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Cookie : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.CookieBuilder with get, set
public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieBuilder ^ Cookie { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieBuilder ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieBuilder ^ value); };

summary.para: Determines the settings used to create the cookie.
defaults to . defaults to true. defaults to .

remarks.para: The default value for cookie name is ".AspNetCore.Cookies". This value should be changed if you change the name of the AuthenticationScheme, especially if your system uses the cookie authentication handler multiple times.

determines if the browser should allow the cookie to be attached to same-site or cross-site requests. The default is Lax, which means the cookie is only allowed to be attached to cross-site requests using safe HTTP methods and same-site requests.

determines if the browser should allow the cookie to be accessed by client-side javascript. The default is true, which means the cookie will only be passed to http requests and is not made available to script on the page.
is currently ignored. Use to control lifetime of cookie authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.CookieDomain : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ CookieDomain { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ CookieDomain { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is Cookie.Domain.")

summary.para: This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is on .
Determines the domain used to create the cookie. Is not provided by default.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.CookieHttpOnly : bool with get, set
public: property bool CookieHttpOnly { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
public: property bool CookieHttpOnly { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is Cookie.HttpOnly.")

summary.para: This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is on .

Determines if the browser should allow the cookie to be accessed by client-side javascript. The default is true, which means the cookie will only be passed to http requests and is not made available to script on the page.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ CookieManager { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ value); };

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ CookieManager { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ICookieManager ^ value); };

Docs.summary:
The component used to get cookies from the request or set them on the response.
ChunkingCookieManager will be used by default.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.CookieName : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ CookieName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ CookieName { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is Cookie.Name.")

summary.para: This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is on .

Determines the cookie name used to persist the identity. The default value is ".AspNetCore.Cookies". This value should be changed if you change the name of the AuthenticationScheme, especially if your system uses the cookie authentication handler multiple times.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.CookiePath : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ CookiePath { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ CookiePath { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is Cookie.Path.")

summary.para: This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is on .
Determines the path used to create the cookie. The default value is "/" for highest browser compatibility.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy CookieSecure { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy value); };

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy CookieSecure { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::CookieSecurePolicy value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is Cookie.SecurePolicy.")

summary.para: This property is obsolete and will be removed in a future version. The recommended alternative is on .

Determines if the cookie should only be transmitted on HTTPS request. The default is to limit the cookie to HTTPS requests if the page which is doing the SignIn is also HTTPS. If you have an HTTPS sign in page and portions of your site are HTTP you may need to change this value.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ DataProtectionProvider { Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ value); };

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ DataProtectionProvider { Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::DataProtection::IDataProtectionProvider ^ value); };

Docs.summary: If set this will be used by the CookieAuthenticationHandler for data protection.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::CookieAuthenticationEvents ^ Events { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::CookieAuthenticationEvents ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::CookieAuthenticationEvents ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The Provider may be assigned to an instance of an object created by the application at startup time. The handler calls methods on the provider which give the application control at certain points where processing is occurring. If it is not provided a default instance is supplied which does nothing when the methods are called.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ExpireTimeSpan : TimeSpan with get, set
public: property TimeSpan ExpireTimeSpan { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };

summary.para: Controls how much time the authentication ticket stored in the cookie will remain valid from the point it is created The expiration information is stored in the protected cookie ticket. Because of that an expired cookie will be ignored even if it is passed to the server after the browser should have purged it.
This is separate from the value of , which specifies how long the browser will keep the cookie.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.LoginPath : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString with get, set
public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString LoginPath { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString value); };

Docs.summary: The LoginPath property is used by the handler for the redirection target when handling ChallengeAsync. The current url which is added to the LoginPath as a query string parameter named by the ReturnUrlParameter. Once a request to the LoginPath grants a new SignIn identity, the ReturnUrlParameter value is used to redirect the browser back to the original url.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.LogoutPath : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString with get, set
public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString LogoutPath { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Http::PathString value); };

Docs.summary: If the LogoutPath is provided the handler then a request to that path will redirect based on the ReturnUrlParameter.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ReturnUrlParameter : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ ReturnUrlParameter { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ ReturnUrlParameter { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The ReturnUrlParameter determines the name of the query string parameter which is appended by the handler when during a Challenge. This is also the query string parameter looked for when a request arrives on the login path or logout path, in order to return to the original url after the action is performed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ SessionStore { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ value); };

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ SessionStore { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::Cookies::ITicketStore ^ value); };

Docs.summary: An optional container in which to store the identity across requests. When used, only a session identifier is sent to the client. This can be used to mitigate potential problems with very large identities.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.SlidingExpiration : bool with get, set
public: property bool SlidingExpiration { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
public: property bool SlidingExpiration { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The SlidingExpiration is set to true to instruct the handler to re-issue a new cookie with a new expiration time any time it processes a request which is more than halfway through the expiration window.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TicketDataFormat As ISecureDataFormat(Of AuthenticationTicket)

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ TicketDataFormat { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ value); };

public: property Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ TicketDataFormat { Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::ISecureDataFormat<Microsoft::AspNetCore::Authentication::AuthenticationTicket ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The TicketDataFormat is used to protect and unprotect the identity and other properties which are stored in the cookie value. If not provided one will be created using .
